value: Hello {name}
and {name}'s reading helper!
This Learn to Read course is designed for a kid and a reading helper to do together.
Words in blue are instructions for the reading helper to read aloud.

Words in brown are instructions just for the reading helper. Sometimes during a lesson, the reading helper may be quiet for a few seconds while they read their instructions. Just be patient when this happens.

value.value: To advance in a lesson, tap on the blue ‘Next step’ button or the right arrow key
Children learn to talk by copying others, but learning to read is a skill that must be taught.

value: Reading follows four steps

value.value:
Identify letters
Identify sounds
Blend sounds
Understand word

Educators often use the words “phoneme” and “decoding”.
Phoneme is the smallest unit of sound in a word.
Decoding is the process of translating written text into spoken words.

value: In this lesson, we’ll learn 3 letters, . . . 3 sounds, . . . a strategy for combining sounds, . . . and read a book together.
After completing each lesson, you’ll earn a gem to use in the Rewards Shop where you can unlock coloring pages, avatars, and other reading rewards.

{name} is not expected to master concepts during the first lesson they're introduced. These concepts will continue to be taught and reinforced in future lessons.
If you find {name} is too frustrated, you can always return and repeat a lesson.

Next, we're going to read our first story together. It’s my job to read blue words, and it’s your job to read the black words. I’ll point to each word with my finger to help you keep track of where we are.

append: Remember, when you read the black words, look at the word and say the sound each part makes. Then put the sounds together to make the word. You can use your arm to help you blend the sounds together.

append.value: Help {name} read each word using Touch & Slide. This is not a quiz, so give them answers when they get stuck. This is just practice and it should be fun.
Also, you may find it natural to talk about the illustrations and the story as you read.
